frame.name: Locale_by_use
frame.definition:
<def-root>Geography as defined by its use.
<ex>You must land in the next <t><fex name="Locale">airfield</fex></t>, as this one is currently having difficulties.</ex> <ex>The new <fex name="Use">sports</fex> <fex name="Locale"><t>complex</t></fex> was the tallest building on campus, oddly enough.</ex> <ex><t><fex name="Locale">Cities</fex></t> <fex name="Container_possessor">of the Northeast</fex> tend to be dingier.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Constituent_parts
FE.definition: <def-root>FN: Salient parts that make up a Locale. <ex>This is the oldest <fex name="Cnst">apartment</fex> <t>complex</t> in Florida.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Container_possessor
FE.definition: <def-root>The location that the Locale is a part of. <ex>John spent several years wandering the <t>villages</t> <fex name="ContP">of Romania</fex></ex>. </def-root>

FE.name: Formational_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>Indicates the action (or causer) which brings the features of the Locale about. </def-root>

FE.name: Locale
FE.definition:
<def-root>A stable bounded area. It is typically the designation of the nouns of Locale-derived frames.
<ex>There used to be a carnival every summer in that <fex name="Lcl"><t>city</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>ULTIMATELY TO BE REPLACED BY MULTIWORD TARGETS (in almost all cases). This FE is used for the Names of Locales. <ex>The <t>city</t> <fex name="Name">of Paris</fex></ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Relative_location
FE.definition: <def-root>A place that a Locale is located with respect to. <ex> The corn <t>field</t> <fex name="RelLoc">across from the highway</fex> has been there for many years.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition:
<def-root>The activity that is carried out in the <fen>Locale</fen>.
<ex>The Campus <fex name="Use">Microscopy and Imaging</fex> <t>Facility</t> (CMIF) serves a wide range of faculty staff and students of The Ohio State University .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any feature or characteristic of the <fen>Locale</fen> not covered by more specific FEs.
<ex>We made our way to a <fex name="des">quiet</fex> <t>farm</t> on the outskirts of Surrey, hoping to be isolated from the goings-on in London.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent <fen>Locale</fen> itself and any of its participants.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: farm.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an area of land and its buildings used for growing crops and rearing animals.

lexUnit.name: hedge.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a fence or boundary formed by closely growing bushes or shrubs.

lexUnit.name: mine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an excavation in the earth for extracting coal or other minerals.

lexUnit.name: field.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an area of open land, especially one planted with crops or pasture.

lexUnit.name: airfield.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an area of land set aside for the take-off, landing, and maintenance of aircraft.

lexUnit.name: cemetery.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large burial ground.

lexUnit.name: rural.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: in, relating to, or characteristic of the countryside rather than the town

lexUnit.name: country.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: districts outside large urban areas

lexUnit.name: countryside.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the land and scenery of a rural area

lexUnit.name: urban.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of or relating to a town or city

lexUnit.name: city.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an inhabited place of greater size than a town or village

lexUnit.name: village.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a group of houses situated in a rural area, larger than a hamlet and smaller than a town.

lexUnit.name: center.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a place or group of buildings where a specified activity is concentrated.

lexUnit.name: facility.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a building, part of a building, or other area designated and equipped for a particular use.

lexUnit.name: complex.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a group of similar buildings or facilities on the same site

lexUnit.name: installation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: military or industrial establishment

lexUnit.name: reactor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an apparatus or structure in which fissile material can be made to undergo a controlled, self-sustaining nuclear reaction releasing energy.

lexUnit.name: harbor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a place on the coast where ships may moor in shelter, either naturally formed or artificially created

lexUnit.name: lab.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a laboratory.

lexUnit.name: plant.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a place where an industrial or manufacturing process takes place.

lexUnit.name: laboratory.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a room or building for scientific experiments, research, or teaching, or for the manufacture of drugs or chemicals.

lexUnit.name: depot.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a place for the storage of large quantities of a commodity.

lexUnit.name: site.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an area of ground where a particular entity is located or where a particular event has taken or will take place

lexUnit.name: school.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an institution for giving an initial education

lexUnit.name: university.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a high-level educational institution in which students study for degrees and academic research is done.

lexUnit.name: factory.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a building or buildings where goods are manufactured or assembled chiefly by machine

lexUnit.name: silo.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an underground chamber in which a guided missile is kept ready for firing.

lexUnit.name: parking lot.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an area used for the parking of vehicles.

lexUnit.name: base.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a centre of operations for military or other activity.

lexUnit.name: settlement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a place where people establish a community.

lexUnit.name: courtyard.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an open area enclosed by walls or buildings, especially in a castle or large house.

lexUnit.name: institute.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an organization for the promotion of science, education, etc.

lexUnit.name: pub.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an establishment for the sale and consumption of beer and other drinks, often also serving food.

lexUnit.name: restaurant.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a place where people pay to sit and eat meals that are cooked and served on the premises.

lexUnit.name: museum.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a building in which objects of historical, scientific, artistic, or cultural interest are stored and exhibited.

lexUnit.name: gallery.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a room or building for the display or sale of works of art.

lexUnit.name: garden.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a small plot of land used for growing vegetables and/or flowers.

lexUnit.name: park.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large public garden in a town, used for recreation.

lexUnit.name: square.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an open, typically four-sided, area surrounded by buildings.

lexUnit.name: theater.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a place where plays and other dramatic performances are given

lexUnit.name: shop.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a building or part of a building where goods or services are sold.

lexUnit.name: college.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (in Britain) any of the independent institutions into which some universities are separated.

lexUnit.name: open space.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: a large, undeveloped outdoor location for public use

lexUnit.name: post office.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a building where postal business is transacted.

lexUnit.name: canal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an artificial waterway allowing the passage of boats inland or conveying water for irrigation.

lexUnit.name: green.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a piece of common grassy land, especially in the centre of a village.

lexUnit.name: park[2].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an area devoted to a specified purpose

lexUnit.name: ranch.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a farm

lexUnit.name: headquarters.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the place out of which an operation is run.

lexUnit.name: downtown.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the economic and commercial center of a city or town.

lexUnit.name: campus.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the area on which a university is located

lexUnit.name: zoo.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a place where animals are kept and exhibited

lexUnit.name: port.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a place on the coast used esp. by trade ships

lexUnit.name: work.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the place at which one is employed or does work

lexUnit.name: court.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a place where legal proceedings are conducted.

lexUnit.name: range.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a large, open space for practicing long distance accuracy

lexUnit.name: compound.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: enclosed area, often with structures and buildings, designated for a particular use.

lexUnit.name: station.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: building designated for a particular use.

lexUnit.name: firehouse.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: building where firefighters are stationed.

lexUnit.name: bathhouse.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a building for bathing, typically for public use.

lexUnit.name: development.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a large group of buildings constructed to form a community

lexUnit.name: plantation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an area of land which contains both an estate and land used (presently or in the past) for farming

lexUnit.name: safe house.n
lexUnit.definition: FN:a location designated for one group of people to stay or meet which is kept secret from another group who might harm them or interfere with their activities. <ex>The police hid the witness in a safe house until after the trial.</ex> <ex>The terrorists met in a safe house to plan their attack.</ex>

lexUnit.name: boutique.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a small shop or specialty store, esp. one selling fashionable clothes or other items
